body: Sounds good to me. I was asked about it multiple times.
Ok, if no objections I will do PR.
what does it do? configure Yii::$container? that is not the job of the application class imo.

It's the same story as with aliases.
What does Application::setAliases() do? configure Yii::$aliases.
And you have it because it allows to setup aliases with **configuration** not code.
According guide:

> This property is provided so that you can define aliases in terms of application configurations instead of by calling the Yii::setAlias() method.

Application config looks good place to put dependencies config. There is no other global config.

> This suggest might look awkward in terms of design, but since we don't have a better way to manage DI in declarative way, it might be implemented.

How about creating an extra config file for that, which will be included in index.php?

> How about creating an extra config file for that, which will be included in index.php?

It's more about **how** then **where**.

Ok, to sum it up: the proposal is to allow dependency injection configuration be: 
- declarative
- located in the standard place
- made in the same way as quite similar construction (aliases)

But I agree that everything can be just left as it is :)
Maybe any new ideas how to configure dependency injection in a nice way?

I dont see the problem in terms of design. DI containers are used in an implementation of Application so why not letting it be configured by Application. Its feels more awkward/hacky to do this in a bootstrap file than to do this in the Application config.

If you do this in Application config, you have way more flexibility and control. You can override DI configuration and have different settings in different Application tiers. This is consistent with the way you are configuring other components of your app. 

It also adds flexibility to the way you are configuring your app. If you think about configuring your Application through a database interface, it would be very comfortable to have DI containers config inside your Application config files. Arrays add flexibility.

issue.title: Added Application::setContainerDefinitions() to configure DI in declarative style

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | no
| New feature?  | yes
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | not implemented yet
| Fixed issues  | #11758

- [x] Draft implementation & docs
- [x] Tests

This PR is an implementation of idea, suggested by @hiqsol in #11758 

The proposal is to allow dependency injection configuration be: 

- declarative
- located in the standard place
- be consistent with configuring of similar construction (aliases)

Example:

config.php
```php

return [
    'id' => 'my-super-application',
    'basePath' => dirname(__DIR__),
    'bootstrap' => ['log'],
    'containerDefinitions' => [
          yii\web\Request::class => app\components\Request::class,
          yii\web\Response::class => [
              'class' => app\components\Response::class,
              'format' => 'json'
          ],
    ]
];
```
